text: Pink Elephant is the fourth album by the Dallas, Texas native N'dambi. Released in 2009 and produced by the legendary Leon Sylvers III, it marks her debut release for the rejuvenated Stax label.N'dambi interview by Pete Lewis, 'Blues & Soul' August 2011 ==Track listing== #"L.I.E." (N'dambi, Shockley, Leon Sylvers III) 4:44 #"What It Takes" (N'Dambi, Sylvers) 3:32 #"Nobody Jones" (N'Dambi, Sylvers, Sylvers) 4:20 #"Ooo Baby" (N'Dambi, Sylvers) 5:11 #"Mind Blowin'" (N'Dambi, Sylvers) 3:36 #"The One" (N'Dambi, Sylvers) 4:50 #"Take It Out" (Marshall, N'Dambi, Sylvers, Williams) 4:12 #"Daisy Chain" (N'Dambi, Sylvers) 3:54 #"Can't Hardly Wait" (Breaux, Butler, Elmehdaoui, N'Dambi) 4:28 #"The World is a Beat" (N'Dambi, Shockley, Sylvers) 4:12 #"Imitator" (Breaux, Butler, Elmehdaoui, N'Dambi) 5:08 #"Free Fallin'" (N'Dambi, Sylvers) 3:22 #"Can't Hardly Wait" (Acapella) (Breaux, Butler, Elmehdaoui, N'Dambi) 4:31 #"The World is a Beat" (Soulflower Mix) (N'Dambi, Shockley, Sylvers) 7:53 ===Album=== {| class="wikitable" style="text- align:center;" |- ! rowspan="2"| Year ! rowspan="2"| Album ! colspan="2"| Chart positions |- style="font-size:smaller;" ! width="40"| US R&B; |- | rowspan="1"| 2009 | align="left"| Pink Elephant | 42 |- |} ===Singles=== {| class="wikitable" style="text-align:center;" |- ! rowspan="2"| Year ! rowspan="2"| Single ! colspan="3"| Chart positions |- style="font-size:smaller;" ! width="40"| US R&B; |- | rowspan="1"|2009 | align="left"| "Can't Hardly Wait" | 78 |- |} ==External links== *Pink-Elephant on Concord Music Group ==References== Category:2009 albums Category:Stax Records albums Category:Albums produced by Leon Sylvers III Category:N'dambi albums
